SEARCH
Module com.example.frontend
Package com.example.frontend

Class ManagerGraphViewController

java.lang.Object
com.example.frontend.ManagerGraphViewController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class ManagerGraphViewController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Controller file for the Manager's Graph View in `manager-graph-view.fxml`. Displays data from the database regarding sales trends, item usages, excess inventory, and other important trends over a user-defined time period.

    Method

    void
    initialize(URL arg0, ResourceBundle arg1)
    Inital function that runs when the FXML is loaded, which sets the default values of the side bar and prepares the buttons to generated different graphs.

    Grabs the necessary Stage object for proper FXML control, allowing for dynamic elements.
    void
    showExcessInventory(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    Generates the "Excess Inventory" graph, which displays the list of items that only sold less than 10% of their inventory between the timestamp and the current time, assuming no restocks have happened.
    void

    Generates the "Product Usage" graph, which displays the amount of inventory used during the user-defined time period.
    void
    showSalesTrend(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    Generates the "Sales Trend" graph, which displays the sales by item from the order history from the database.
    void
    showWhatSellsTogether(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    Generates the "Sells Together Trend" table, which displays a list of pairs of menu items that sell together often, popular or not, sorted by most frequent.

    • setPrimaryStage

      public void setPrimaryStage(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
      Grabs the necessary Stage object for proper FXML control, allowing for dynamic elements.
      Parameters:
      primaryStage -

    • showSalesTrend

      public void showSalesTrend(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Generates the "Sales Trend" graph, which displays the sales by item from the order history from the database. Reads from the inputted date range and queries the menu items sold, displaying each menu item sold, the amount sold, and the revenue generated.
      Parameters:
      event -

    • showWhatSellsTogether

      public void showWhatSellsTogether(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Generates the "Sells Together Trend" table, which displays a list of pairs of menu items that sell together often, popular or not, sorted by most frequent. Queries the user-defined dates to check pairs of menu items by popularity.
      Parameters:
      event -

    • showProductUsage

      public void showProductUsage(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Generates the "Product Usage" graph, which displays the amount of inventory used during the user-defined time period. Sends a query for items sold between the two dates and generates each inventory stock used. Displays a bar graph sorted from greatest inventory used to least.
      Parameters:
      event -

    • showExcessInventory

      public void showExcessInventory(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Generates the "Excess Inventory" graph, which displays the list of items that only sold less than 10% of their inventory between the timestamp and the current time, assuming no restocks have happened. Grabs the date from user input and queries the items that has sold invalid input: '<'10% of their stock, returning a table of menu items, items sold, items remaining, and how much stock it sold.
      Parameters:
      event -

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL arg0, ResourceBundle arg1)
      Inital function that runs when the FXML is loaded, which sets the default values of the side bar and prepares the buttons to generated different graphs. Each button corresponds to a helper function that displays their respective graph, and displays the current user in the top-bar.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
